title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children node is listed. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information. Actual result: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Check if the data source has any database/table/column information. 3. Change the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. 4. Verify if the children nodes are listed properly. 5. Close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
